content.default: This widget will not be seen in Collector

content.text:
Welcome to this opportunity to share your perspectives and experiences with our shared efforts to understand and deal with climate change. This study is an effort initiated by the Cynefin Centre which is the research group affiliated with www.cognitive-edge.com.

This study is an open-source effort which means that anyone who participates can access the results through an online public dashboard. In this way we hope to help individuals and organizations in understand the micro and macro challenges presented by the changing global climatic conditions.

Everyone's participation is voluntary and ensuring confidentiality is our highest priority. At the end of your session you will be offered an opportunity to add your email address on a Google Form which is completely separate from your entry. This decoupled list allows us to share a link to the outputs of the study without retaining any association to your entry! Thank-you for your participation and please share a link to this site to others who may want to participate!

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title:
Think about recent events, or actions taken, by individuals, businesses, organizations or governments related to climate change and its consequences.

Share ONE example that you think will have an impact. It might be positive or negative, direct or indirect. Briefly describe it below.

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: Suggest a #hashtag or title that summarizes this example:

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: Would you say this example reflects a contribution that is...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: Would you say this example reflects a contribution that is...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: The people involved in this example are...

content.text: Thinking about what was shared above, click and drag the marker to a position in the shapes that best reflects this example. The closer the marker is to one side, the stronger this element/concept is. If in doubt, go with a gut feel placement. Click 'N/A' if a question does not apply.

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: The potential for positive change in this situation will come from...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: The example I described was influenced by consideration for...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: People’s knowledge or awareness came from..

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: A sense of responsibility in this moment came from...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: This could have been avoided if...

labels.text: Big business(es) had taken more initiative

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: This situation relates more or less to...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: How do you feel about the lessons learnt from this example? (select up to 3)

items.title: Frustrated - it may be useful but won't make a difference
Optimistic - there is work to do but we are starting to move
Cynical - even if it works no one will take the risk
Motivated - the changes I make can have an impact
Angry - all of this could have been avoided
Worked up - I want to rally with others to protest and take action
Despair - when will people take this seriously?
Paralyzed - the situation is so big it is out of my control

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: Reflecting on your example, which of the following questions is most relevant?

items.title: What do we most value that we want to keep? [resilience]
What do we need to let go of so that things don't get worse? [relinquishment]
What could we bring back to help us with these difficult times? [restoration]
With what and whom do we need to collaborate with?[reconciliation]

content.text: In your opinion which sectors are low carbon emitters, high carbon emitters, or are somewhere in between? Position the marker on each slider where you think that sector sits on a carbon emissions spectrum.

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 5. Industry (paper, food, petroleum refineries, chemicals and metal/mineral products)

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: Thinking about the one or two sectors you placed furthest to the right above (the ones having the most impact) briefly describe below what you think those sectors need to do to lessen their impact.

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: What realistic changes do you think individuals should make? (Select up to 3)

items.title: Change transport (use public transport, drive electric vehicles, bike, fly less, etc.)
Reduce use of packaging and disposable items (shopping bags, plastics, etc.)
Use, or subscribe to, renewable energies (solar, wind, etc.)
Use efficient technologies in the home (LED lights, Efficient appliances / heating, etc.)
Change diet (eat local, reduce or eliminate meat consumption, etc.)
Create more green spaces (plant trees, gardens, etc.)
Shop more consciously (reduce use of imported goods, certain clothing items, etc.)

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: What gender do you identify with?

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: What is your highest level of education?

items.title: College / University (degree in process, diploma, certificate, or not complete)
